statements: SELECT cocktail_name, price FROM cocktails WHERE cocktail_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM cocktails WHERE units_sold > 100;
SELECT cocktail_name, units_sold FROM cocktails WHERE price BETWEEN 10.00 AND 20.00;
SELECT price, cocktail_name FROM cocktails WHERE price > 5.00 ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT cocktail_id, cocktail_name, units_sold FROM cocktails WHERE cocktail_id IN (2, 4, 6);
SELECT cocktail_name, price FROM cocktails WHERE units_sold > 100 ORDER BY price DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM cocktails WHERE cocktail_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT cocktail_name, units_sold FROM cocktails WHERE price < 10 ORDER BY cocktail_name ASC;
SELECT cocktail_name, price, units_sold FROM cocktails WHERE units_sold > 50 AND price BETWEEN 5 AND 20 ORDER BY units_sold DESC, price ASC;
SELECT cocktail_name, cocktail_id FROM cocktails WHERE price > 15 ORDER BY cocktail_id;
SELECT * FROM cocktails;
SELECT name, price FROM cocktails WHERE price >= 10;
SELECT cocktail_id, name FROM cocktails ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT SUM(total_revenue) AS total_sales FROM sales;
SELECT name, quantity, total_revenue FROM cocktails JOIN sales ON cocktails.cocktail_id = sales.cocktail_id;
SELECT * FROM cocktails;
SELECT name, price FROM cocktails WHERE price > 10 ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT cocktail_id, SUM(quantity) AS total_sold FROM sales GROUP BY cocktail_id HAVING total_sold > 5;
SELECT c.name, s.quantity, s.total_revenue FROM cocktails AS c INNER JOIN sales AS s ON c.cocktail_id = s.cocktail_id;

SELECT c.name, SUM(s.quantity) AS total_quantity, AVG(s.total_revenue) AS avg_revenue FROM cocktails AS c LEFT JOIN sales AS s ON c.cocktail_id = s.cocktail_id GROUP BY c.name HAVING avg_revenue > 15;
SELECT * FROM cocktails;
SELECT cocktail_name, cocktail_price FROM cocktails WHERE cocktail_price > 10;
SELECT customer_name, order_date FROM customers INNER JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;
SELECT cocktail_name, order_quantity, total_price FROM cocktails INNER JOIN orders ON cocktails.cocktail_id = orders.cocktail_id;
SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT cocktail_name, cocktail_price FROM cocktails WHERE cocktail_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT c.cocktail_name, c.cocktail_price, o.order_date, o.order_quantity FROM cocktails c JOIN orders o ON c.cocktail_id = o.cocktail_id WHERE o.order_quantity > 5;
SELECT c.cocktail_name, SUM(o.total_price) AS total_revenue FROM cocktails c JOIN orders o ON c.cocktail_id = o.cocktail_id GROUP BY c.cocktail_name;
SELECT customer_name, COUNT(*) AS total_orders FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id GROUP BY customer_name HAVING total_orders > 2;
SELECT * FROM cocktails;
SELECT cocktail_name, price FROM cocktails ORDER BY cocktail_name ASC;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT order_id, quantity, order_date FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT revenue_id, total_amount FROM revenue WHERE total_amount > 100 ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT cocktail_name, price FROM cocktails WHERE price > 10.00 ORDER BY cocktail_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;

SELECT orders.order_id, cocktails.cocktail_name, customers.customer_name FROM orders JOIN cocktails ON orders.cocktail_id = cocktails.cocktail_id JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id;

SELECT cocktails.cocktail_name, SUM(revenue.total_amount) AS total_revenue FROM cocktails JOIN orders ON cocktails.cocktail_id = orders.cocktail_id JOIN revenue ON orders.order_id = revenue.order_id GROUP BY cocktails.cocktail_name HAVING total_revenue > 100.00;
SELECT * FROM Cocktails;
SELECT cocktail_name, price FROM Cocktails WHERE price > 10 ORDER BY cocktail_name DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM Customers WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY customer_id;
SELECT order_id, quantity, order_date FROM Orders WHERE order_date >= '2021-01-01' ORDER BY order_date ASC;
SELECT sale_id, total_amount FROM Sales WHERE total_amount < 100 ORDER BY sale_id DESC;
SELECT cocktail_name, price FROM Cocktails;
SELECT customer_name, order_date FROM Customers JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id;
SELECT cocktail_name, quantity FROM Cocktails JOIN Orders ON Cocktails.cocktail_id = Orders.cocktail_id;
SELECT customer_name, total_amount FROM Customers JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id JOIN Sales ON Orders.order_id = Sales.order_id;
SELECT * FROM Orders WHERE order_date >= '2022-01-01';
